pros: job security, christmas chocolate box! competetive salary based on similar jobs in the local area.  holiday allowance is good, in own department always willing to be flexible.  fairly relaxed working day within own department.  recognition scheme works well in general even though it is just a token gesture. open door policy works but getting results is a different matter
cons: lack of promotion based on merit and actual ability, management team selected on basis of who you know and not what you know, cliquey atmosphere.  not interested in helping employees reach their potential. working environment could be better, cramped office space, bad building maintainence.  inability to apply its own policies.

review_title: UPS - Don't work for them- the Union Sucks.....
pros: To provide a little extra income.  The income is very minimal, though, and the Union takes alot of it- in exchange for underrepresentation.  The union is simply the Mafia- skimming money from the person doing all of the hard work and making the unions/reps richer.
cons: You are litterally overworked and underpaid.  The pace is too fast for most individuals.  Turnover is 50%, as they tell you when you are hired.  The work is dangerous and the equipment is outdated and not kept up.  The lighting is poor.  The climate control is absent.  The working conditions are horrible- I don't know how the Union employees put up with it- did you ever notice that UPS employees never strike- I think that UPS pays off the Union to avoid strikes.

review_title: Not a bad place to work during college.  If you stay after that take a good look around.
pros:
- Usually you have great job security, but not always.
- Non-union employees get about 35-40% of their tuition paid for as long as they stay 2 years after graduation.
cons:
- Promotions and raises are based on length of service rather than merit even for NON-union employees.
- Few UPSers perform the bulk of the workload while others skate by doing as little as possible.
- Non-union employees are treated as union when it benefits the company, but are treated poorly when they feel they can get away with it

job_title: Seasonal Driver Helper in Waldorf, MD
pros: Pay was reasonable ($10.50/hr). The large number of routes virtually guarantees that more than 15 minutes of commuting would be rare. Fast paced environment makes the day seem to pass quickly. Not much supervision other than your assigned driver.
cons: The trucks do not have a radio. If your driver is not great, there is not much you can do. Uniforms were not provided or fit so poorly that they were not wearable. A lot of walking/jogging that becomes unbearable if you are injured. The hiring process was extremely unorganized and took much longer than it should.

review_title: If you are willing to work hard, and want the commitment, it's a great place.
pros:
It's easy as hell to get the job; just do what they tell you to and don't act like an idiot.
It's a unionized workforce, so the managers can't treat you shitty unless you aren't doing what you need to.
cons: The hours are really rigid unless you've worked for them for a while, and you don't get paid the really good money till you've been there a few years. And even though it's part time work, it will wear you out, so you gotta be fit if you want to do anything else during the week. I'd also point out that those self-driving Google cars will probably be having an effect on UPS soon, but the union will probably ensure that there are still some driving positions.

review_title: Great if you want to make money and miss out on family life.
pros: Financial security, excellent compensation/health and medical benefits. Great place to learn managerial and organizational skills while on the job. 90% of the people are friendly and fun to be around.
cons: Executive level Managers are arrogant and out of touch. Hey Exec's: This is not the same company YOU grew up in. You can't manage everything by checklist. That's called micro-managing and UPS is great at that. No creative space for young, talented, innovative problem solvers because Managers think they know what is best instead of listening and supporting their front-line people.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Harrisburg, PA
pros: Great benefits that none can match. Work can sometimes be fun and the people are usually great.
cons: Very bad management and employee relationship. They seem to hate each other most of the time. Labor intense job that doesn't allow much self improvement unless you move on to management. Also it is a unionized company, and with most unions you always attract really lazy people that shouldn't be there and are there just for a paycheck.   Also, if you do doubles, or go full time, say good bye to your social or family life.

pros: Usually done before 9:30am, so the rest of your day is wide open if you have another job or school. Everyone gets along pretty good. The supervisors seem to genuinely care about you.
cons: You have to wake up very early. Normal start time is usually between 4-5am and it is not even the busy season yet. I heard they start as early as midnight during the holidays. it is physically demanding, and can be mentally  overwhelming at first. Benefits don't kick in until after a year.

pros:
Great Pay and Benefits
Work on your own without someone over your back
Meeting new people(networking)
Learn safe driving habits
Don't have to pay for uniforms(except socks)
cons:
Very Labor intensive(sometimes lifting up to 150lbs)
Some supervisors have poor people skills
Hard to get a day off, even if you have sick/personal days
UPS tracks almost every movement do while working(seatbelt, time at each stop, use of parking brake, etc)- this can be an issue if they have it out for you!

job_title: Early AM Loader in North Logan, UT
pros: Health benefits are incredible even while part time.
cons:
Easily mornings, constant turnover and poor working conditions. Management offers little help and creates many of the problems at the Logan center. There is essentially no heat in the building while temperatures reach single digits and below. Management does not care a lick about employee personal lives and expect the part time job and their word to be above all else. 

Rules are not followed and employees are ignored about standard regulations and safety issues. None of which are reviewed on a regular basis as instructed. Employees are coached the day of an audit to respond correctly and put on a farce. 

Stay away if you are a student or anyone with a second job/ commitment. Managment will gladly mislead you until you stick around long enough to take advantage of the excellent health coverage.

pros:
The pay is better than most places, especially without a degree or prior experience. 
The tuition benefits are generous.
cons:
The hours are HARD. Preloaders work veeeeery early morning shifts, especially during peak season. If you are strictly a day person this is not the job for you. 
This is a very physically demanding job. Expect to be sore and uncomfortable.
Delivery drivers are *supposed* to help load the trucks as preloaders near the end of their shift but only half of them actually help. This can cause delays in preloaders getting off work on time. 
The union fees are steep!
It gets cold. REALLY cold. There is minimal heating throughout the building and none if your truck is outside. 
Minimal opportunities for promotions.

job_title: On Road Supervisor in Burtonsville, MD
pros:
High Salary
Hard to get Fired
cons:
Toxic work environment
They take advantage of salary employees and consistently overwork them
Little to no transparency in promotion process or promotion opportunities
Most management are time committed  in positions as a result of being promoted from within, but have no formal education or training in management. They cannot make a comparable salary elsewhere which leads to UPS being able to dictate how long they work, where, and even in what capacity. Hourly employees get paid more, have better benefits, and get a retirement through the Union.
Stress Leave is a real thing for management here

review_title: UPS, it's not for everyone. But if you fit in, you'll be working for one of the BEST companies in the world!
pros: One of the most financially stable companies in the world to work for. They really take doing the most with the minimum to extremes. This is very important in todays ultra competitive economy. Just be ready to WORK, WORK, WORK! There are NO easy jobs at UPS.
cons: They can be a little behind on newer technologies which makes an employees life safer and easier. (I.E. Power steering for drivers, hoists for mechanics, etc...)

review_title: It's Okay if you bust your butt
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Greensboro, NC
pros: Benefits are awesome (medical/pharm/dental/vision and tuition reimbursement!!) Compensation is premium, with non-merit based increases semi-annually. Small work teams. If you like good pay (8.50 to start) for mind-numbing repetitive work, this is a great place. Find out about the current "Union contract" from your co-workers to best maximize your stay here.
cons: The Union!! Stuck in same paygrade regardless of experience, or job effectiveness, or even job task. Everything is based on seniority (how long you have been with the company).  Slackers are compensated identically to hard workers, so there is no incentive/reward for doing a great job (except personal pride, which many are lacking). Job openings are filled by longest-standing employees, not by one best able to do the job.

review_title: At UPS I gained a great amount of knowledge about the small parcel shipping environment in a couple of months.
pros: Management really respects and values their employees.  Compensation was good.  The company as a whole is structured very well for growth, and really cares about their customers.
cons: Not enough advancement opportunities in the department I was located in.  As an intern I was unable to have any benefits.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Farmingville, NY
pros:
Decent pay (compared to minimum wage)-9.50/hour
Good growth potential
Union (after 30 days on the job)
Benefits
Lots of hours (during holiday season)-some weeks you will work 50 hours
Off on Weekends (Saturdays optional)
Very simple work day (for the most part you do the same thing every single day)
cons:
8-9+ hours of back breaking work per day
Usually odd hours (midnight 'til around 8AM, some days later)
Little to no communication from upper management
Inconsistent work days (Some days will be very busy, others very, very slow)
Union (after 30 days on the job)
Occasionally messes up Over Time pay
Boring work
Some managers are dicks, others are cool.
Way too often short handed on workers, sometimes do the job of 2-3 people.
Only one 10 minute break per day (no lunch break).
Very simple work day (for the most part you do the same thing every single day)

pros: Pays for your schooling. Depending on what you're experienced with the more pay you get.  Overtime is nice for holidays..
cons: Upper management cuts down the amount of people it's supposed to take to handle the amount of volume in a days work, causing complete chaos. Damaged packages, improper lifting due to amount of volume per one trailer to load or sorters to sort. Caused lots of injuries.  Management wouldn't always "document the injuries"...sounds pretty illegal to me.  Hourly employees are union so they pay union dues.  Also the union employees I worked with were so slow my 90 year old grandpa could out load them.  That's pretty sad when they use the union to cover their butt so they continue to work extremely slow.  Makes everyone else's job that much more difficult.  Don't get me wrong occasionally you'll find someone who takes their job seriously, but that doesn't happen often.

pros: Great company.  It is a well known leader in the industry that commands respect.  That makes it easier to get meetings with new clients.  The people I came into contact with there were helpful.  It is a team atmosphere and they spend a lot of time on continuing education to make sure everyone is at their best.
cons: Strict sales goals and reviews.  As with any sales position there is pressure to meet those goals and exceed them the next year.  Working in logistics also gets stressful when things on the operations side fail.  You must work well with the center managers and drivers and be able to compromise well for the good of the clients.  However- remember that the drivers are king.  When costs need to be cut they started doing away with some of management benefits.

review_title: FULL TIME MANAGEMENT IS EXPECTED TO WORK ON CHRISTMAS DAY OF CORPORATE DECIDES!
pros: Your paycheck will always be on schedule. You'll learn a ton about what not to do as management.
cons: They think they own you once you go into full time management and receive a stock bonus. They actually sent out a memo telling full time management employees to "be available" to work on Christmas day as if being screwed the entire month of December, especially on Christmas eve, wasn't enough. They said "we're not telling you to cancel your travel plans... Just be available to work at your destination if needed."...on CHRISTMAS DAY. So to hell with your time and family, let's make sure our employees hate the abusive company they work for.

review_title: FULL TIME MANAGEMENT IS EXPECTED TO WORK ON CHRISTMAS DAY OF CORPORATE DECIDES!
pros: Your paycheck will always be on schedule. You'll learn a ton about what not to do as management.
cons: They think they own you once you go into full time management and receive a stock bonus. They actually sent out a memo telling full time management employees to "be available" to work on Christmas day as if being screwed the entire month of December, especially on Christmas eve, wasn't enough. They said "we're not telling you to cancel your travel plans... Just be available to work at your destination if needed."...on CHRISTMAS DAY. So to hell with your time and family, let's make sure our employees hate the abusive company they work for.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Addison, IL
pros: Good tuition and healthcare benefits. The hourly rate is fairly average. Met a lot of good people working there. If you stay at this job for a long time almost any physical job you will have after this one will seem relatively easy.
cons: The work drains you physically and mentally. Very dusty environment and the temperature inside is usually 5-10 degrees warmer than outside whether it's summer or winter. There is a culture of pushing people to work faster no matter what, and it comes from upper management putting pressure on the others to get done faster. A lot of people didn't last long working here.

job_title: Customer Service Team Lead in Guatemala City
pros: This is a review for the Guatemala Call Center.  Morning schedules are good and the amount of hours you work is reasonable. The facilities are nice enough and there's an on site cafeteria. Pay is OK but could be much much better.
cons:
On site cafeteria is a little overpriced. There are no facilities for breastfeeding mothers even though they have over 800 employees. 
Problems with supervisors are not handled nor are unfair working conditions fixed if there is a problem with the supervisor.

job_title: Package Handler in San Fernando, CA
pros: Easy to get hired, pay is 12 which is okay as an 18 year old with another job.
cons:
Upper management had to get good numbers so their bosses are happy, so they'll treat the package handlers as slaves to load/unload the trucks, if you finish one they assign you to another one within seconds. They treat you like dirt and have fake conversations with you to try and make you come in extra days and different shifts, Can't really say no because then you'll be on their bad side, they'll try and get rid of you. I got fired for calling in sick for my 2nd time. I worked here for 7 months.
Hard work for little pay and its all about seniority, the longer you're in the hellhole its harder to get out because they'll trick you into thinking you getting a higher position.

job_title: Project Manager in New York, NY
pros: One of the best parts of working at UPS is the can do attitude that is embedded from day one. There is nothing that we as a company cannot accomplish and many times we are challenged with near impossible asks and continually deliver. The mantra of 'we promote from within' has proven to be true more times than not, however it seems as though this mentality  might be diminishing.
cons: It seems as though leadership is not on the same page, it almost seems as though there is a power struggle at the top and everyone in the company is feeling it. UPS likes to promote family values and work life balance, however they do not practice what they preach. People are expected to put work first over everything, if you are interested in promotions you need to be willing to relocate.

job_title: Part Time Supervisor in Hodgkins, IL
pros: Decent pay and benefits that's it
cons: I've been with UPS for over a year now and a Part time supervisor for seven months. I did my first peak reached all the right numbers am in the top 3 on a regular basis been told I'm getting shirts and jackets and haven't seen a thing. Occasionally you get a good job thanks but most of the time they focus on anything and everything you do wrong. Hours are cut drastically after peak and so is your staff, enjoy doing all your own unloading and loading because they don't care. This job is depressing and so incredibly stressful. Integrity is a bunch of crap there as well upper management should follow the rules they make.

pros: UPS offers a phenominal benefits package, even for part-time employees. The company prides itself on promotion from within, so advancement is directly related to how much you want it and how hard you are willing to work for it. I have met many members of senior management and all of them started as hourlys. In additon, the holiday season results in a LOT of overtime pay for someone who can put in the hard hours. A great job for a college student, the hours leave open most classtimes and the company supports education. Often promoting employees immediatly after graduation.
cons: The work is hard and demanding. The pace is always fast and the hours leave much to be desired. However, the pay scale reflects this.

review_title: Solid company with many opportunities to move up and job security if you follow all rules & procedures.
pros: The ability to move to other positions.  Hard to get fired unless you wanted to.  UPS supports United Way and denotes a lot of money to help ours and the communities.  UPS offers 3% return in stocks on 401K and offers  good benefits for full time employees.
cons: Fast pace environment, can be exposed to a few chemicals mainly smog from the trucks.  Could get injured if not following the safety rules.  The moment you enter a UPS facility, you are being watched.  UPS measures everything by numbers.

review_title: UPS is changing for the better
pros: Good benefits and vacation time.  Pension plan is a major benefit as most major companies don't have a pension plan.  UPS can be very flexible depending on the type of job you hold with them. Solid job security as long as you are doing your job.  UPS does not typically lay off their management staff and has shown loyalty to their management team.
cons: Challenging workload, overbearing corporate culture.  UPS is affected by the current state of the economy.  Sometimes the managers at UPS are not always the best because UPS has been the only company they have ever worked for and they don't realize what real life is like outside of UPS.

review_title: If my kids even applied for a job here, I would break their legs!
pros: Decent money but not as good as some other trucking companies.  Decent benefits as long as the company doesn't keep trying to cut them.
cons: Company activly seeks to fire every employee every day.  Company trys to take away every benefit with every new union contract.  Not a day goes by that someone doesen't talk about retiring.  No one can wait to get out of there, even management.  Company will turn your work schedule and life upside down and not think twice about it.  You are just a number!.

review_title: It was a good company to work for.
job_title: Seasonal Golf Cart Driver In A Residential Neighborhood in Houston, TX
pros: Pretty much total independence to do the job however you liked. Once my packages were delivered, it was totally up to me to sort them and set the delivery routes that worked best for me. I was a golf cart driver in a residential neighborhood delivering packages for the holidays. Any time I had a problem with the computer DIAD, management was extremely helpful.
cons: Not enough training on the DIAD before I started delivering packages on my own. I was basically doing the same duties as a full time driver for a fraction of the pay. No windshield on the golf cart.

review_title: Don't make the mistake of turning down this position. It's your biggest door opener!
job_title: Package Delivery Driver in Dallas, TX
pros: Generous compensation package and benefits.  No chance for nepotism or cronyism which makes it a fair field for advancement.  Training and education of employees is the ceiling of industry standard which gives career a boost if another opportunity arises elsewhere.
cons: Very fast paced career from the start.  Working conditions are based on the weather of the region.  Strict rules to abide by while wearing uniform or driving (protects company name and image).  Don't make plans unless it is on your day off.

pros: This place paid 100% tuition for the college I went to.  A lot of benefits.  Fast pace work environment, make the shift go by really fast when bulk shipments come through.  Also btw.  I was employed by UPS from 2006-2007.  Its pretty crappy that website doesn't allow for me leave that option blank when when the drop down doesn't go back that far.
cons: For 1st time starters the hours were low.  I barely got 4hours a night at my short time there.  I had to fight people off for peak season hours too.  Working 3rd in order for them to pay my college 100 percent was horrible but I couldn't be too mad because I had my school paid for.  I don't know if they still do it though.  The program was called the Metropolitan college...something something....

pros: The benefits and salary at UPS are exceptional but you have to work for it. They will get every cent out of you and then ask for more. You have to bleed brown for the company as they say. The union looks out for the employees and is money well spent. Health insurance is awesome and second to none. I was proud to wear the uniform and felt respected by customers.
cons: Management can be difficult to work with at times. They will lie to you and tell you what you want to hear. They are all about the numbers and making their job easier.

job_title: Seasonal Driver Helper in Bellingham, WA
pros: My driver was very kind and flexible about picking me up later in the day if I needed to do something that morning. Also, being picked up right at my door was amazing because I don't have a car.
cons: We had to work in all kinds of weather, so when it rained I would get soaking wet and there's nothing you can do about it, you just have to work through it and get cold. They also don't provide gear beyond a pullover coat that you have to wear. If you want warmer clothes you have to wear them under the shirt or coat they provide. The pants were too big for me so I didn't wear them at all.

review_title: So far, the only regret in my life
pros: I met a number of great people during my time there; and all of them looked forward to retiring or getting away from UPS with their humanity intact.
cons: I could write a volume based on my 10 years working at 2 different locations.  #1 con would be the treatment you receive at the hands of managers that have lost touch with their humanity.  Company is not concerned with customer service anymore, they squeeze management and employees for everything they're worth.  That being said, along with the exasperating Christmas season experience, wages and benefits (for management) are not much compensation for how much of your life they expect in return.  Your career path will have nothing to do with your personal preferences, you will be expected to take what is offered,if you are that lucky to be offered a promotion, unless you are a complete misanthrope-in which case you will rise quickly.

review_title: the opinion of a worker bee.
pros: great union job the pay is very good,but you work for every penny.
cons: Work your Butt off , very long days can be stressful at times.Management has tendency to dispatch to much work.

review_title: I don't know much about him which warrents a 2.
pros: medical, vision, and dental benefits, work schedule vs school schedule UPS will work with you. For the most part, UPS  and Teamsters provides a strong sense of job security. Considering our huge drop in volume in the Kentucky district over the years; UPS has yet to lay off  any employees.
cons: The extendend wait for  full time oppurtunitys, the wait in my building for full time driving is about 8 years from date of part time hire. The wait for 22-3 combo fulltime is about 10-12 years from date of part time  hire.  Most the jobs are very physical, you better prepare for a long physically demanding career. Their is no climate control while loading a truck. In the summer. Trucks are 120 degrees; in the winter its 10 below 0.

review_title: Ok to work for. Union there sucks though.
pros: 2500 Tuition reimbursement per semester. Flexible with scheduling. Simple job but have to be willing to work hard. Great exercise and/or workout.
cons: The union there is terrible. You have to pay a years worth of union dues before you get any benefits. People there who have been around for a while have seniority even if they are terrible workers, show up late, do not show up at all, sometimes even show up with alcohol on their breath. There is a real lack of discipline.

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Phoenix, AZ
pros: It pays decently. You can learn a lot as a sales person.
cons: This place is a stomping ground for Managers and Supervisors to act like Gods. They treat you like crap and don't appreciate your work. They place these stipulations on you that are not reasonable. It is also hard to get promoted unless you 'drink the kool-aid' or suck up to get it. It has been the most unpleasant work environment that I've ever been in. All of the minorities that started from class 1 and on are STILL here.  A few people quit because there wasn't any opportunity for minorities and they feel discouraged from applying for better opportunities.

pros: Benefits, company equipment, expenses, travel, not in an office all day
cons: Work-life balance, micro manage, poor communication, poor leadership within the facilities and divisions, poor bonus structure

job_title: Account Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: The training is great, you will learn a lot if you apply yourself and ask a ton of questions, It looks great on a resume and if you are smart you can make the position sound better in a future job interview than it really was, benefits are good, reputable and respected company to work for.
cons: Micromanagement to the max! No one can explain your compensation plan to you, you only have but so much control over how much ppl ship with you but you are expected to reach really ridiculously aggressive sales goals, felt like the company tried to screw ppl out of their bonuses. lots of ppl quit because of this.

review_title: Great foundation for sales. Report you to death.
pros: Good job security. Lots of creative solutions to help businesses. Provide a great foundation with sales training.
cons: Constantly reporting. Many times the reports are asked for last minute, and sales professionals are told to drop whatever their doing to provide the requested information. Too often this takes away from selling activities. Sales professionals manage existing customers, and often have to spend more time providing customer service to existing customers because even the"Preferred Customer Service" team is lackluster. Incentive pay is based on too many variables out of your control (e.g. if your customers meet their volume and revenue goals as planned by UPS; local, national, and international operations working properly).

review_title: Get worked like an absolute dog...but at least you get paid?
pros: Literally the only upside of working for UPS is the compensation. You get paid very high in comparison to other jobs in the market and get great benefits, but those are the only PROs.
cons: You are treated very poorly by management even when you are in management. They have a very old school toxic management culture where they want someone who screams and yells to get things done rather than a sensible tactic. This starts at the very top of the company and just rolls down to every position there. They will work you for as many hours as they can which when you are a full time supervisor literally has no limit. You could work 80 hours during season on salary.

review_title: Good Student job, poor working conditions
pros:
Good schedule for being a student
Great benefits
cons:
Warehouse in winter would always be sub zero temperatures, management would hide in offices to stay warm and tell us it wasn't very cold.
If you killed yourself working extra hard one day to reach a quota, management would discipline you for not working that hard the next day.  I have nothing against making people work as hard as they're supposed to(sometimes fellow employees wouldn't), but it got to the point that some people were required to work twice as hard as others all because they worked harder one day and that was what was expected from then on.

review_title: Not a good long term job...
pros: We got paid once a week. We were given OT pay for working over 5 hours in one shift. Good short term job.
cons: Employees weren’t informed until the day before what time to come in. We didn’t work scheduled hours; no one left until everything was done. Managers would stand over your shoulder yelling at you to work faster (yes, they seriously did this). Managers were extremely critical. Only given  a ten or twenty minute break. All levels of management I dealt with were unprofessional.

review_title: A constant headache with poor support
pros: Full benefits for part-time work. Part-time supervisors almost never sit at a desk and are constantly moving, which can provide little to no boredom, but can also become physically demanding. Since the turnover rate is so high there is constant job security knowing they’d struggle to fill your position effectively.
cons: As the very lowest level of management, hourly employees know you have nearly no authority to enforce what is necessary, but you completely lack the required support from upper management when needed. Managing the constant chaos and ever changing decision making of upper management gets tedious and eventually leads to complete lack of morale for the company and its workforce.

review_title: Good part time job, especially for college students.
pros: Same hours every day, GREAT tuition reimbursement program, okay pay, excellent health benefits (kick in after a year), easy to get hired. Perfect job for college students or people who just need an extra job.
cons: Not a lot of flexibility in hours and days off. They will expect you to be there every single day and not to be late. Some supervisors are more flexible than others. The job can be monotonous, since you will probably be doing the same thing every day. Also, if you can't lift 70 pounds, don't bother applying.  It takes a year for health benefits and paid vacation to kick in.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Timonium, MD
pros: Large company, stable employment, nice training initiatives
cons:
Ever since Mike Eskew stepped down as CEO, the corporate culture spiralled downward.  The new CEO was a beancounter, and every action had to be justified in terms of direct ROI.  As a result, a lot of software bugs never got fixed, because nobody wanted to take the risk of trying to make something better if people were used to it being barely mediocre.  So, most of people efforts devolved down to CYA, as they took away every perq that made the place worth working there.

There are better places to work that pay more and actually value emplyoee contributions.

review_title: If the position is non union, don't do it!!!!!!
pros: I work around is nice. You can learn a lot from the company if you have the right supervisor. I really can't think of nothing else. Sad I know
cons: If you are Union you can do whatever you like. I've seen people get fired 6 times and got their job back. Management talks to employees like trash. Hack management talks to each other like trash. The benefits for non union is awful!!!!! And still make us pay for it. Oh, but union gets great benefits and don't pay one penny. I'm pray hard for a new job.

review_title: Great place to get experience, terrible place for a career
job_title: Customer Solutions Engagement Supervisor in Dallas, TX
pros: UPS has a very strong brand and reputation in the transportation industry. Their market share makes them leader in global commerce and provides them with a lot stability. They are fiscally conservative which gives them reserves to outlast a recession.
cons: UPS does not invest in technology outside of their package operations which makes working for them a challenge to say the least. They pay you as little as possible. Commission structures are setup in a way that if you have a good year, you're sales plan for the following year will be impossible to achieve.

review_title: MY ADVICE:WORK BARE MINIMUM! STAY OFF THEIR RADAR
pros: benefits. uhm. just benefits. oh.. if you dont mind making at MOST hitting 13 an hour for the next 10 years you might one day get more than 17 hours a week! =) or you can go driver....soon as the first 5000k people ahead of you on the list make it.. try the lottery. might have better chance at success.
cons: Bad pay. treated like garage. work your back off and youll be on the radar to keep working until youre no longer of use then thrown aside. my advice to you is stay off the radar. work the bare minimum, which is sad to say but they will abuse you if you make their radar as someone who can move fast. Therefore, work just enough to get by.

pros: The people you work with are what makes this job fun unless you're a driver. Easy to get extra hours here.
cons: It takes an average of 3 to 5 years to get a full time position. Sometimes you get lucky and get it after a year(driver or management positions.) Keep a log of your hours! They will shave time off sometimes, ALWAYS log your hours.

review_title: Good First Job for Anyone but Do Not Recommend Staying Long Term
pros:
Co-workers were amazing, always helping each other out and making the day better.
You are able to save up many days to take off and hours are set but if you need a day off, it shouldn't be a hassle.
cons:
Everyone who loads is overworked. You usually leave the day feeling sore but you eventually get used to it. 
An all male environment can make women there feel uncomfortable, especially because there are some creeps and perverts there.
Expect to be treated unfairly as your time there passes by. Sometimes seniority rules are overlooked and you could be stuck doing more than you should.

review_title: Over 30 and glad it’s almost over
pros: Interesting, check always gets deposited. Pay will be very good at first and then will taper off. UPS looks very good on your resume.
cons: UPS trusts no one. It’s a constant state of audit. Customers are secondary. You will hear about customer service but will feel the pressure to make cost plans. Safety process is ridiculous. The work environment is a warehouse. The best office has cinder block walls and desks made out of filing cabinets. New employees are treated better than long term management employees. You will be working in the weather. Whatever you do is never good enough. UPS has a philosphy that you constantly need to improve.

job_title: Part Time Supervisor in Hodgkins, IL
pros: Ups will help pay for school. They also like to promote from within the company which for some people can turn their job into a career.
cons: Proper training and accountability has dropped amongst part time supervisors. New supervisors take a 2 week class that focuses on employee relations which is a good thing but skips out on hub operations. Meaning the new sups hit the floor and don't really understand what they are supposed to do. They used to pair up new sups with a training supervisor to show them how to run their area before leaving them on their own. Now they hope the experienced operations sups will be able to show them what they need to do while simultaneously running their own area.

review_title: UPS is a great place to work if you can handle stress.
pros: Pay is amazing and so are the benefits.  I made 60k+ my first year out of college not including commission and my yearly bonus.  The majority of employees bleed brown and have a strong sense of pride in UPS.  The company has a variety of perks including a turkey for each employee for Thanksgiving and tons of discounts with various venders.
cons: The stress level at UPS is pretty high, especially when the economy is not doing well.  Work-life balance can be tough to achieve.  Many employees work 10+ hours per day.  High pay early on can make it difficult to leave the organization, rarely will you be able to make that much elsewhere.

review_title: IF you have a family or want a personal life you may want to look elswhere
pros: Responsibilties well beyond job descriptionand title. Level of responsibilty at evrery level makes you very competative once you leave UPS.
cons: Hostile work environment - constant threatening environment from Management. Absolutely no work[life balance. If 8 holidays a year entices you, long commutes, and inequity in salary and raises thrill you this is the place for you. There's nothing like driving  hours to work  each way everyday just to get threatened all day! Nothing is more frustrating to have your boss with a high school diploma or an Associates degree tell you you need to go back to school in order to get promoted.

review_title: Not bad if you can't find anything else, and don't mind working hard
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Secaucus, NJ
pros: well known company, good benefits for part-time, recognition for a good job, good record on safety, opportunities to go into other areas
cons: constantly over-exerting yourself, demanding supervisors, gets very hot during the summer and you need to drink a lot of water, expect to sweat a lot, soreness in your muscles (very little or no soreness if you lift weights a lot in terms of reps), dust gets into your nose (you'll see this when you blow your nose)

review_title: Secure job but treats employees poorly
pros: Good job security, work schedule is Monday through Friday,excellent insurance and benefits, all major holidays are off with pay,
cons: Treat supervisor poorly , Yearly raises don't cover rising insurance premiums or cost of living so unless you want to have a huge chunk of your check taken out to pay for insurance you are forced to take higher deductibles and less coverage. Management does not appreciation work that you do. supervisors are always putting in extra hours without additional pay. Company acts like your whole life should revolve around UPS even though it is a part time job

review_title: Secure job but treats employees poorly
pros: Good job security, work schedule is Monday through Friday,excellent insurance and benefits, all major holidays are off with pay,
cons: Treat supervisor poorly , Yearly raises don't cover rising insurance premiums or cost of living so unless you want to have a huge chunk of your check taken out to pay for insurance you are forced to take higher deductibles and less coverage. Management does not appreciation work that you do. supervisors are always putting in extra hours without additional pay. Company acts like your whole life should revolve around UPS even though it is a part time job

pros: Stability. Benefits. Proximity to home. Ability to transfer jobs and utilize acquired knowledge  that has been obtained. The pay is FINALLY Acceptable
cons: Opportunities for promotion are limited by possession of college degree in related field and it is promised that experience is accepted but in many cases it is not

job_title: Frontline Supervisor in San Jose, San Jose
pros: If you are a minority then you don't have to worry about your qualifications, you will be put at the top of the list to be promoted so that HR can keep up with their percentages of minorities in each department and levels of management.
cons: Corporate is unable or unwilling to change with the current job market, they offer jobs (entry level or lower management) that are paid much higher with similar benefits, if not better, anywhere else. I can easily see the company diminishing in the next 20 years because we are severely behind the times with our antiquated systems and approaches to ordinary and simple issues. If you want to work for a company that only cares for its' shareholders then UPS is that company.

pros: Ups offer great benefits every part-time new hire should take advantage of, the main one being tuition reimbursement for those interested in investing in themselves. They offer great healthcares  plans, pto, vacation pay and promotion within. You'll definitely earn everything they have to offer.
cons: Depending on where you're at seniority wise, you'll be moved around often or replaced.  There's also a high turn rate of employees and good pay that reflects minimum wage checks. You'll work in a warehouse and will have to tolerate changing  climates.  Don't apply if you're lazy.

review_title: Good experience depending on the team and management.
pros: Large employer, good experience and challenging work depending on an analytical role (good) versus reporting role (not challenging). Benefits are good.  Management on the profit side have a positive attitude.
cons: The cost finance team has a very toxic work environment in Chicago. High turnover rate due to dictatorial management team. Overtime is expected at this location due  to high turnover; you are also expected to commute between 3 locations. Often, cost management yells at and berates employees which is unacceptable in a professional setting.  Chicago Profit team: Yes; Chicago Cost Team: Join at your peril!

pros: Some of the people are good
cons: I work part-time at the Palatine location. I've been told there is retaliation by employees if someone goes to HR with a complaint. One employee there was verbally abused by another employee but refused to report it to HR as they were scared of the other employees. If you get hurt the company will blame it on the employee even if it wasn't the employees fault. The attitudes here are bad. Supervisors talk out loud about employees and make disparaging comments about them. If you promote people there needs to be training on how to be a supervisor and have the right attitude. People are not treated with respect here and then UPS wonders why they can't hire or keep people.

review_title: If you want the career they want you to have then you'll like it. If you have personal career goals then look elsewhere.
job_title: Inside Sales Supervisor in Chicago, IL
pros: Stability, they have been around 112 years. Strong specific culture.
cons: Set in their ways, they know they need to change but mid management has all been woth thr company for 20-30 years so they dont buy in and it makes it bad for lower level employees. Non union employees also get cuts to their benefits to pay for union employees. If you are non union and last year was a contract negotion, get ready for them to make a change to you to pay the union.

review_title: Best of luck, though it CAN work
pros: Great if it works for your schedule.  Decent benes.  Union backing.
cons: The only people who steal more from Ups than the employees are the big buisness customers.  Broken equipment doesn't get fixed.  Employees are treated badly.  Constantly understaffed.  Huge turnover rate.

review_title: UPS, we don't actually treat people the way people think we do.
job_title: Senior Account Manager in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Employee Ownership and Brand Recognition.  UPS is the market leader in the small package industry and we are truly the best.  I could not work for any other transportation company besides UPS.
cons: Too many to list.  However, I would have to say poor management and disrespect towards employess, lack of career advancement.

review_title: Respectable company.  Good quality of life.  Not for those with ambition.  Company grows slowly...so will your career.
pros:
Job security.  Have always felt that there was never any real chance of getting let go during down times at UPS.
Looks great on a resume. 
Decent benefits package.
Management respectful of employees; work/personal time conflicts handled fairly.
cons:
UPS corporate purposely offers salaries at average or just below average for the industry.
You must be very patient to get promoted at UPS.
There are just too many people who have been at UPS for 15+ years.  You must understand if they waited to be promoted so must you.
Good company and quality of life; but if you have ambition you'll find yourself looking elsewhere after a few years.

review_title: Great pay and benefits, but company (management) cares nothing about its employees.
pros: Pay and benefits are awesome (thanks to Teamsters)! Get extra week vacation every five years. Great co-workers and get to meet and know all kinds of people (good if your a peoples person).
cons: Very unbalanced work/life. Constantly being harassed about production standards that are unrealistic and contradict their safety protocol. While overtime is good I would dare to say there is to much here. You hardly ever get to see your family.

review_title: Very good company, wish I could get my job back.
pros: UPS provided me with great salary and benefits for only working there part time.  Management had an open door policy and they stuck to it.  Opportunities for promotion were there as long as you worked hard and were competent.  I felt very informed about company news and was treated with respect.  I wish I never quit because now I realize how good I had it.
cons: The work environment for most people is in the factory.  Factory environments are loud, dirty, repetitive, and boring.  However, there are lots of other opportunities within the company so you aren't stuck in one place.

review_title: Very professional and customer orientated company
pros: UPS offer a good general package and working conditions. it is possible to earn shares at mid managament level. The company has many different transportation solutions both national and international.
cons: As a sales manager, sales goals can be very challenging especially when you are not in complete control of your portfolio of customers. as a strategic account manager, you not only manage european based companies, but also the EMEA piece of a US global company's account where all the decisions are made in the US, even the decisions regarding EMEA distribution. This can lead to a clash of opinions and be detrimental to the overall management of the account at the highest level.

review_title: Worst job I have ever had
pros: The hours are Monday - Friday 10AM - 3PM which allows for a good work-life balance. Tuition assistance and health benefits after one year of employment.
cons: Training was not thorough. Information was presented out of order per the training guide provided. Some pages in the training guide were just skipped all together. Was told to sign off on things we learned even though we had not gone over them yet. There is a lot of yelling and barking of orders to scare you into working faster. Intimidation  and bullying is a tactic they use to speed up production. Lots of micromanaging goes on here.

review_title: i liked the work didn't like the hours or pay.
pros: well if your looking to go to school great place to work for there financial benefits for school and possibly further advancement in the company over time while your in school.
cons: you don't have time to get a fulltime job anywhere else because of there unstable work hours which leaves you with empty pockets.

job_title: IQA Part Time Supervisor in Palatine, IL
pros:
Turkey at Thanksgiving, Well Secured Hub, Nice Upper Management, HR to help, Great Dental Benefits 

You get the Best Training which helps you succeed.  There is great team spirit including sups with UPS on there license plates
cons: If you don't like working outside, in the winter you could get sick easier due to the doors having to stay open.  At least they used to in IQA--  /    People used to take supplies to there area etc. and then you would have to go and retrieve them

job_title: On Road Supervisor in Chattanooga, TN
pros: Good Pay, 401K (for now), benefits
cons: Absolutely no work-life balance, hostile work environment, archaic company culture

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Burtonsville, MD
pros: Great benefits, if you stay long enough to gain access to them. With exception of tuition and some discounts, it typically takes approx. a couple months to a year to gain access to some of the better benefits. Amazing tuition reimbursement system. Given the type of work, you could definitely make a little more, but the pay's generally fair. Mostly chill supervisors and managers, if your lucky. If you show up and do the work, you'll be fine. You'll likely get in better shape and lose a little weight too.
cons: Hardly any or nonexistent break times. Hard to stop in the middle of sorting to use the bathroom. Achey feet and sore muscles from work, but that could be because I came in during peak season. Super cold in warehouse during winter-- no heat or A/C during the summer.

job_title: Local Sort Supervisor in Norfolk, NE
pros: Benefits, and most employees are friendly.
cons:
Poor management 
Starting pay scale for part time employees that is low, right around minimum wage.
Communication is also poor between management and different sorts.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Albany, OR
pros:
- Opportunity to move up quickly if you're experienced, intelligent and a hard worker
- Base pay is a bit above min. wage (new contract kicks in soon so it will be $13/hr), but during peak you get a ton of overtime (anything over 5 hrs worked in a day is OT) 
- Fantastic Workout
- I personally work with wonderful people (only one, or two "bad apples")
cons:
- Hours are rough if you're not adaptable
- Can get chaotic during peak, but we always seem figure it out 
- Sink or swim

review_title: Good pay, Good training, bad communication
job_title: Seasonal Package Driver in Mobile, AL
pros:
--  Training, Safety, Free uniforms 
--  Overtime is good (b/c you're "slow" due to new route in unknown area)
--  HR department is helpful
--  Online site: lots of benefits!
cons:
-- As a seasonal, you're just a number.  Almost like a new guy showing up on the front lines.... nobody cares -just work fast!!    
-- The hiring took a few days, then you do over 25 hours of computer based learning (on your own time!)  before going to "training week".  Then your paid/hr.
-- Terrible pressure to know your "route" of unknown area.  (Have a map!)

review_title: Strong company, but improvement in culture is needed.
pros: Great benefits!  Stock contribution (note it does take five years to earn 2009 contribution--you get 20% each year).  They promote within the company.  They attempt to not lay off as much as possible--job security.
cons: It is militaristic environment.  The culture is a bore.  Very operational driven.  Many meetings that do not get a lot accomplished.  Involved in many philanthropies, which require donations (strongly urged and noted).  The longer you have been with company more opportunities to move up.  Long hours are required.  And low pay in comparison to industry standard.

pros: A secure job with a large successful company. Good opportunities to advance if you are willing to put in the work but may take years. Competitive  pay and benefits package (although not what it was pre-recession). Teamwork atmosphere is enjoyable.
cons: The hours can be erratic including working nights or really any hours you can think of due to the 24 hour operation. I have had regular assignments working both 6 to 4's and the bad 9 to 5. Long hours at Christmas time. Many times overly intense management from above with very aggressive performance goals. Often dirty and tiring depending on your position.

review_title: It has it's ups and it has it's downs.
pros: The tuition reimbursement is very good as well as their benefits. You will learn great leadership skills as well as a good work ethic.
cons: The communication from upper management and their clarity in their orders are very unclear. The fingers get pointed at the one who has the lowest seniority no matter who is to blame. It feels like you are in high school with the rumors and the BS you have to deal with. The union environment is almost impossible to work in and makes it even more impossible to fire or discipline the employees who need corrective action.

pros:
- Great benefits
- Steady income 
- Some room for advancement

Some of the upper management can be a headache, but the management is usually great to work for especially if you work hard and show up on time every day.
cons:
- Working in tough weather conditions
- A lot of lifting
- Some employees are really unmotivated to do the job. 
- Corporate positions are out of state. 

I've been a supervisor for a few years now. The biggest drawback is that you have to constantly motivate employees. Most of the time it is the employees with more seniority (they feel like they are "owed" for being there so long). Overall, not a bad experience

job_title: Driver Helper in Port Huron, MI
pros: The hiring process is very simple. If you have a clean background, you are in with no questions asked! Physically strong individuals will enjoy this job.
cons: Your work hours are sporadic. The coordinator does not call you in to work everyday, which wasn't mentioned at all during orientation. You often do NOT get the same driver everyday, and some drivers do not offer you even a five minute bathroom break, which can be an issue if you take certain medications like diuretics for blood pressure. Coordinator does not communicate well at all. Issues with being issued a work uniform that is too tight and restrictive if you are a larger and more muscular person.

pros: UPS is a promotion from within company so even though you may start out as a pt package handler if you are ambitious and career minded the opportunities for advancement will be there.  Full time drivers are the best paid in the industry and full time management get yearly stock options on top of a very competitive salary.  Part time package handlers get full time benefits at no cost.  Some UPS locations offer tuition assistance.
cons: Part time package handle wages are very low but are offset by the full time benefit package they receive.  Work hours for both full time drivers and full time management are very long often reaching 60+ hours a week for management.

review_title: Safe, efficient and well run company.
pros: If you're looking for a fast pace for short periods of time, this is the place for you for a part-time position. The training program is excellent and the supervisors are very helpful - a great team environment. Safety is a big concern and the company spends a lot of time and money to make sure safety goals are met.
cons: The work can be very fast paced at times, and the heat in the summer and cold in the winter can be a challenge. Not a good place to work if you don't like to sweat.

pros: Benefits! Tuition aid begins immediately. Major can be any, as long as the school is accredited and it leads to a degree. $50K max. Health benefits do not begin until a year; however, it is 100% paid by UPS. Union backed, so wages are good.
cons: Did I mention that it is brutal?!? If you're male, young, and extremely fit, then you will not suffer. I'm older, female, not in good shape. I suffer greatly, but trying to survive to reap those good benefits down the road. The culture reminds me of the movie "Planet of the Apes". There is a lot of swearing .. macho-type young male roosters crowing and flexing their chests/muscles.

review_title: If you know how to work hard, you'll be fine
pros:
The biggest pro of them all... Part timers get full benefits for their family after being employed there for a year.  You honestly can't beat the health and dental benefits anywhere else.  They are amazing. 
There are opportunities to move on into a supervisor or driver role if you are so inclined.
cons:
Management says they care about safety, but the don't. They care about how many boxes are being moved per hour, and that's it.
The pay isn't the greatest, but hey, it's hard labor.
Start and end time are always changing weekly based on volume for the day. 
When UPS warehouse gets audited everyone works different but as soon as those auditors leave all hell breaks loose and it's back to normal.

pros: You get to leave home and eventualy youll die from overwork so you wont have to go back.
cons: i worked at cach,their biggest facility.i decided to quit when dan neville,regional manager at the time, yelled,berated me and threatened to fire me   because instead of filling out SALT sheets, i was to busy loading packages since they cut out hourlies to save on operation costs.Now managment is not allowed to load due to the union and upper managment yells of they catch you but god forbid you do not get a trailer filled and out on time.dont have the employees?not their problem its your fault your employees called off. so what if you do suck as a superviser?no problem theyll just put you into training department.yes i dont understand that logic either.

job_title: Seasonal Driver Helper in Edison, NJ
pros:
Good job for introverted people !
If you and your driver get along it makes things way easier and you are likely to get partnered up with him as well .
cons:
Compensation is to good to be true , they were having a special incentive of $150 which we were supposed to get every week if we worked five days in a row , for three weeks I worked five days in a row and received that compensation for only one of the three weeks just as heads up . 
Hours also aren't always accounted for .
Getting your paycheck is also a mission in itself because everyone is all over the place .

review_title: Someone slept with management hated me because I knew
job_title: Small Sort/Picker/Unload and Load/Safety Commity in Hilliard, OH
pros: School help...not a real job...very little to be responsible for...the had to pay me 6 weeks of vacation to resign...thanks union
cons: Pay. Politics, let's just say the 165 to 185 bucks per week...caused me to sell shoes drugs juice and snacks to co workers...until ups told me they get half the money from vending machines so stop....I was selling 32 oz. Gatoraids king size candy bars and 20 sacks. For 1$... I made more than a weeks paycheck from buying Gatorade on sale selling for 1$...

pros:
New facility. 

Some nice colleagues.
cons:
- Poor work-life balance

- Mismanagement

- Very unprofessional

- missed payments

- False promises

-Threatening work

-Hacks
